questions.question_text: Which of the following is a best practice when writing a search string?

choices.C: Include the search terms at the beginning of the search string.
choices.B: Include at least one function as this is a search requirement.
choices.D: Avoid using formatting clauses, as they add too much overhead.
choices.A: Include all formatting commands before any search terms.

questions.question_text: What type of search can be saved as a report?

choices.C: Only searches containing a transforming command.
choices.A: Any search can be saved as a report.
choices.D: Only searches that generate statistics or visualizations.

discussion.content: A is Correct

questions.question_text: What can be included in the All Fields option in the sidebar?

choices.A: A field that appears in any event.
choices.B: A field that appears in every event.
choices.C: A field that appears in the top 10 events.
choices.D: A field that appears in at least 20% of the events.

discussion.content: D, page 79

questions.question_text: When viewing the results of a search, what is an Interesting Field?

discussion.content:
The key word here is Statistics Tab. According to the Splunk Documentation: "If the search generates calculated data that appears on the Statistics tab, you cannot export using the Raw Events format." PDF is only available for saved searches. Therefore, the answer is B.

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.1.0/Search/ExportdatausingSplunkWeb
B. CSV, XML, JSON

Selected Answer: B
B is correct. For Raw Ã‰vents : "If the search generates calculated data that appears on the Statistics tab, you cannot export using the Raw Events format. "
Answer is D. The dropdown for formats include Raw Events, CSV, XML, & JSON.
the sure answer is B

Supported export formats answer will be different based on the question asked see the conditions below:
You can export Splunk data into the following formats:

Raw Events (for search results that are raw events and not calculated fields)
CSV
JSON
XML
PDF (for saved searches, using Splunk Web)

Ans is B

If the search generates calculated data that appears on the Statistics tab, you cannot export using the Raw Events format.

72 PDF - D

questions.question_text: When a Splunk search generates calculated data that appears in the Statistics tab, in what formats can the results be exported?
